Pittsburgh.Frederick J. Osterling Office and Studio: The Frederick J. Osterling Office and Studio at 228 Isabella Street in the North Shore neighborhood of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, was built in 1917. This Gothic Revival building was designed by architect Frederick J. Osterling, and was used as his office and studio. It was added to the National Register of Historic Places on September 5, 1985, and the List of Pittsburgh History and Landmarks Foundation Historic Landmarks in 2004.
